page.title: 07COMPUTER DAIRY FARMING
page.content: One dairy farmer in our square uses a computer to help him with his herd of 111 friesians. All the cows have a collar around their necks, it is called a transponder. The computer can tell how old the cow is, how many calves it has had and how much food it eats a day.In the milking parlour ten cows stand each side of the milking machine but only ten cows can be milked at one time. The machine is connected to the computer which records the amount of milk given by each cow. After milking the large glass bottles are taken to the dairy where the milk is pasturised. This is done by passing the milk through a special machine which raises its temperature to 72'C this kills off all the germs. The milk is then cooled and bottled.
